result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Berezinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Defendant is informed  may not possess any firearms.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.
No contact with Citgo located at 1715 10th Avenue, South Milwaukee.
Cooperate with any counseling programs deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain AODA and Mental health assessments and complete follow-up care/treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Berezinski

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Daniel J Berezinski not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is requesting a brief adjournment of the sentencing.  Case set for 3-30-3016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Daniel J Berezinski in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Daniel J Berezinski in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Daniel J Berezinski not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requested a projected plea date. Parties advised as of February 1, 2016, this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Daniel J Berezinski in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Daniel J Berezinski in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 1715 10th Ave, South Milwaukee.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel J Berezinski in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Daniel J Berezinski in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
